Table Statistics

tabStats.Rd

Determines if variable is continuous or categorical and returns the appropriate summary statistics.

tabStats(
  x,
  BY,
  digits = 3,
  conFunc1 = conDataFun1,
  conFunc2 = conDataFun2,
  catFunc = catDataFun,
  digits.categorical = 1,
  parName
)

Arguments

x

numeric vector to summarize
BY

stratification argument
digits

number of significant digits in continuous data summaries
conFunc1

defaults to conDataFun1
conFunc2

defaults to conDataFun2
catFunc

defaults to catDataFun
digits.categorical

passed to catFunc
parName

is automatically populated but the parameter name can be specified here by the user.

Value

Appropriate statistic for x

Note

This function is primarily used for demographics tables

See also

conDataFun1, conDataFun2, conDataFun3, catDataFun, tabSummarize

Examples

pkpdData = example.pkpdData()
ok = duplicated(pkpdData$id) == FALSE
tabStats(x = pkpdData$race[ok], BY = list(dose = pkpdData$dose[ok]))
#>           parameter          0        100        250        500        All
#> 1 pkpdData$race[ok]                                                       
#> 2             Asian  6 (18.8%)  6 (18.8%)   3 (9.4%)   3 (9.4%) 18 (14.1%)
#> 3             Black  5 (15.6%)  6 (18.8%)  5 (15.6%)   2 (6.2%) 18 (14.1%)
#> 4         Caucasian 18 (56.2%) 18 (56.2%) 24 (75.0%) 23 (71.9%) 83 (64.8%)
#> 5             Other   3 (9.4%)   2 (6.2%)   0 (0.0%)  4 (12.5%)   9 (7.0%)
tabStats(x = pkpdData$race[ok], BY = list(dose = pkpdData$dose[ok]),
parName = "Race", digits.categorical = 0)
#>   parameter        0      100      250      500      All
#> 1      Race                                             
#> 2     Asian  6 (19%)  6 (19%)   3 (9%)   3 (9%) 18 (14%)
#> 3     Black  5 (16%)  6 (19%)  5 (16%)   2 (6%) 18 (14%)
#> 4 Caucasian 18 (56%) 18 (56%) 24 (75%) 23 (72%) 83 (65%)
#> 5     Other   3 (9%)   2 (6%)   0 (0%)  4 (12%)   9 (7%)
tabStats(pkpdData$sex[ok], list(dose = pkpdData$dose[ok]))
#>          parameter          0        100        250        500        All
#> 1 pkpdData$sex[ok]                                                       
#> 2                F 15 (46.9%) 11 (34.4%) 12 (37.5%) 15 (46.9%) 53 (41.4%)
#> 3                M 17 (53.1%) 21 (65.6%) 20 (62.5%) 17 (53.1%) 75 (58.6%)
tabStats(x = pkpdData$wt, BY = list(dose = pkpdData$dose))
#>        parameter                  0               100                250               500               All
#> 1    pkpdData$wt                                                                                            
#> 2      Mean (SD)         75.3 (8.9)         76.2 (12)         78.0 (9.8)        75.7 (9.9)         76.3 (10)
#> 3 Median (range) 76.0 (56.0 - 92.0) 74.5 (46.0 - 105) 79.5 (54.0 - 98.0) 78.0 (43.0 - 104) 77.0 (43.0 - 105)
tabStats(x = pkpdData$bmi, BY = list(dose = pkpdData$dose))
#>        parameter                  0                100                250                500                All
#> 1   pkpdData$bmi                                                                                               
#> 2      Mean (SD)         22.9 (4.0)         23.6 (5.7)         24.6 (4.7)         24.2 (4.3)         23.8 (4.8)
#> 3 Median (range) 23.0 (16.7 - 35.5) 23.0 (12.0 - 36.4) 24.6 (16.0 - 38.8) 24.2 (12.0 - 32.8) 23.6 (12.0 - 38.8)
